alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Laramie Valley; South Laramie Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 18 at 11:16AM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Albany County through NOON MDT... At 1115 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles north of Bosler, or 29 miles north of Laramie, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Albany County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Laramie Valley; South Laramie Range
